author: Odeinoichus
title: A Safe to Skip offering from LEGO Dimensions
review:
Set #71257 Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them Fun Pack: This additional pack from the Wizarding World features the other main playable character from the main Story. This way you can take a different character into other worlds and levels, and have her team up with Newt. Yep, this set features Tina Goldstein.

Packaging

Tina is posed with a spell at the ready while buildings can be seen in the background. The back shows off the Adventure World so you can see where you’re going once you unpack this set.

Parts

This set is rather minimalistic with the parts, honestly despite having 51 pieces this set feels a bit lacking once you finish building the model. Aside from the Toy Tag I don’t think anything unique or uniquely printed is included here.

Minifigures

Tina Goldstein: Featuring unique printed torso and legs the character of Tina is dressed as we see her in the film, I believe this outfit is what she primarily wears through the entire film and the CMF comes with the intro scene for the character outfit. She has a unique new hair piece with hat and hair combined, a smiling and scowling facial expression and the old lightsaber blade element for her wand. A nice unique looking character to add to your collection.

The build

Swooping Evil: This creature is featured in the climax of the film to escape from MACUSA and here you get to build it, this is a fun little build and looks nice.

Brutal Bloom: This build is actually a really nice looking one with some very good re-use of parts. It is a quick and easy model to complete and then you can take it into the game as part of your adventure.

Crawling Creeper: This build makes a strange looking insect model and is equally impressive, in the case of this set I feel that the two alternative builds are more engaging and interesting for the models.

The completed model

Swooping Evil & Alternative Models: All three of these models are unique and quirky in design, while the Brutal Bloom and Crawling Creeper are pretty solid in their designs I find the Swooping Evil to be guilty of the one thing most LEGO models should never suffer. It falls apart way too easily due to how the wings are connected, if you pick it up the wrong way you can easily separate the model and have the Toy Tag toppling to the floor instead of coming off the Toy Pad with you.

The Digital Content

The Adventure World: It’s the same place you visit as the Story Pack, so there isn’t much else to say here. This pack unlocks only the Adventure World though, you cannot play through the Story Levels with this set.

Battle Arena: Tina unlocks the Fantastic Beasts Arctic Animal Habitat battle arena, while similar in name to Newt’s set, this is a different battle arena. Not much really to say, as I may have said before I haven’t visited any of these later set Battle Arena’s.

Character & Vehicle Abilities: Tina has the Acrobat, Water Spray, Target, Laser Deflector, Diffindo, Illumination, Stealth, Magic and Apparate Access abilities, she can also Destroy Silver LEGO Objects. A large number of abilities.

Swooping Evil starts out with the Guardian Ability and acts as a Playable Character, similar to the Niffler. The Brutal Bloom gains the Tow-Bar and Vine Cut abilities and acts as a Special Weapon, the Creeper can Dig, Super Jump and use Electricity. A decent selection of abilities for the three builds in this set.

Overall opinion

Honestly, this is the first Fun Pack where I’m going to not recommend it. There is nothing unique here for the abilities and the Story Pack has more content, the only reason to purchase this would be to have access to all of the Battle Arenas in the game, nothing else here is needed to complete the game. While I enjoyed some of the models, this is a bit of a weaker set being offered through LEGO Dimensions. So, I have to say it can be skipped. Not Recommended.
